title: Heart Rate Monitor ANT+ BLE
summary: Heart Rate Monitor with of ANT+, Bluetooth 4.0 protocols and Android Wear.
description: The HRMonitor allows you to monitor and record your heart rate data. Application can interact with wearable heart rate monitor devices via ANT+ or Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocols. Also, we supports devices on Android Wear.Note: At this time, we does not support all types of heart rate monitors. Now we support wristband devices. Tested  with: Mio Link,  Scosche Rhythm+, LG G Watch Urbane (W150). Xiaomi Mi band 1S (read special remark first)*Attention! Application doesn't support the most chest strap devices by now.But as per some customer's reviwes it works fine with Polar H7 and CooSpo ANT+ straps.Application doesn't work with FitBit devices.If you use other equipment, and it works with our application, then please let us know.Application has several settings for customization: type and color of chars, sound indication on/off, GPS settings.=== Available features ===** Standard version: **- Display rate, including maps Google Maps;- Display minimum, maximum and average values of heart rate, distance traveled, altitude difference (with the GPS) and calculation of calories;- The creation of a user profile;- Storage of the last three measurements;- Sound indication of heart rate (no sound, permanent, start/stop, by the level);- Two types of heart rate zones.*** Extended version *** (in addition to the standard version):- Remove restrictions on the number of entries in the history of measurements.*** Export version *** (in addition to the standard version):- Data export in XML, CSV and TCX (Training Center XML) formats.* Remark about Xiaomi Mi band 1S. Attention!  Support of this band is in beta version now. As per special data interchange process you should un-register your band in official Xiaomi application first.  Let us know if you have any issues with it please.
descriptionHTML:
The HRMonitor allows you to monitor and record your heart rate data. Application can interact with wearable heart rate monitor devices via ANT+ or Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocols. Also, we supports devices on Android Wear.

Note:

At this time, we does not support all types of heart rate monitors. Now we support wristband devices.

Tested with:
Mio Link,
Scosche Rhythm+,
LG G Watch Urbane (W150).
Xiaomi Mi band 1S (read special remark first)*

Attention! Application doesn't support the most chest strap devices by now.
But as per some customer's reviwes it works fine with Polar H7 and CooSpo ANT+ straps.

Application doesn't work with FitBit devices.

If you use other equipment, and it works with our application, then please let us know.

Application has several settings for customization: type and color of chars, sound indication on/off, GPS settings.

=== Available features ===

** Standard version: **

- Display rate, including maps Google Maps;
- Display minimum, maximum and average values of heart rate, distance traveled, altitude difference (with the GPS) and calculation of calories;
- The creation of a user profile;
- Storage of the last three measurements;
- Sound indication of heart rate (no sound, permanent, start/stop, by the level);
- Two types of heart rate zones.

*** Extended version *** (in addition to the standard version):
- Remove restrictions on the number of entries in the history of measurements.

*** Export version *** (in addition to the standard version):
- Data export in XML, CSV and TCX (Training Center XML) formats.

* Remark about Xiaomi Mi band 1S. Attention! Support of this band is in beta version now. As per special data interchange process you should un-register your band in official Xiaomi application first. Let us know if you have any issues with it please.
comments: Horrible date picker, please change.  Works well with CooSpo chest strap and S8. Interface could do with improving. I like the alarm option but needs to be able to be more customisable as in several types of alarm at once and different/ custom sounds.  At this moment language can be either English or Russian.  Let me know if you'd like free help translating the app to Spanish. Keep it up.

OK just got a garmin hrm-tri. Imagine disappointment when ant+ USB stick didn't support the strap.    Thus app appears to work it connects and records but need it to tell strap to record a sessoo n and then download it.  Want to download so might have to splurge for download capabilities.  So far it's ok.  Will add more as needed

Tried several apps including Runtastic which used to work, but this was the only one that would connect to my Zephyr Hxm2 Smart HR monitor. The UI isn't Material, but if you want to see your heart rate zones and GPS history, this does that.

Tested with Polar H7 band. Works very well.   Application does what I expected it to do. There are no problems with prolonged usage, tomorrow I ma going to have app run measurement for an entire day.  Edit : picked it up again and I cannot find my Polar H7 monitor in connect section. Did something change in application? It worked like charm during spring 2017. My hrm is instantly detected by polar beat software.

(1) Stops responding if I don't give location permission, likely to stuck in an infinite loop. (2). Doesn't work with my ANT+ heart rate monitor, while Stava app and Cyclemeter app do. Already gave permission to access location & body sensors but it just doesn't detect my heart rate monitor. | xiaomi redmi note 3, android 6

Not a good start. I've not even used it yet and ..  1. I had to press the back button 712 times to set my birth date, a truly appalling date picker, the worst I've ever seen, ever, anywhere, and I've been writing software since 1976. Unless you want to send me a birthday card why not just ask for my age?  2. I paid for the version that allows export of data and found that it still shows adverts, apparently there's another charge to remove the adverts.  3. You can uninstall it but you can't get a refund because "As your item was available for immediate delivery you agreed to waive your statutory withdrawal period. See the Google Play Refund Policy and the Terms of Service." That's a new one on me.  I'll review this later when I've tried it, I hope I can give it some stars.
